conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Dose Interruption
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase level that triggers a temporary interruption of dosing.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation for Discontinuation
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase level that triggers permanent discontinuation of dosing.

conditions.name: Neutropenia for Dose Reduction
conditions.description: Decrease in neutrophil count that triggers a dose reduction.
conditions.text: > 30% ↓ from baseline Neutrophils below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury for Dose Interruption
conditions.description: Combination of elevated bilirubin and ALT that triggers a temporary dose interruption.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening that requires evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of psychiatric worsening that requires evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee must review data before dose titration.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Adaptive Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The outpatient period can be extended with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

transitionRules.name: Enrollment
transitionRules.text: participants who sign the informed consent form (ICF), are eligible for the study, and are registered on Day -7 when participants are assigned a participant number.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing is required.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing is required.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 5 × ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Serious hypersensitivity reaction.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Optional Dose Maintenance at 15mg
transitionRules.text: participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study... if there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretion Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor or Investigator Termination of Study Site
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason... The Investigator may initiate study-site closure at any time, provided there is reasonable cause and sufficient notice is given.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point prior to Day 29 to determine if a participant can be titrated from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day based on SRC review of safety data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety-Based Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing monitoring of safety parameters (liver function, blood counts, neurologic/psychiatric status) that may trigger a dose modification, interruption, or discontinuation.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Outpatient Period Extension Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: At the end of the first inpatient period, the Investigator may decide to extend the subsequent outpatient period by up to 14 days.
